title: The Mysterious Murder at Manor House
story: It was a dark and stormy night at Manor House. The ancestral home of the wealthy Johnson family was known for its opulence and secrets.
In the early hours of the morning, a piercing scream shattered the silence. The next day, the body of Mr. Johnson, the patriarch of the family, was found lifeless in the library.
Detective Parker was assigned to the case. As he entered Manor House, he was met with a sense of foreboding. The investigation was about to begin.

suspect.name: Emma Johnson
suspect.alibi: Emma claims to have been asleep in her room at the time of the murder.
suspect.confirmation: However, her alibi is yet to be confirmed.

witness.name: Dr. James Richardson
witness.observation: Dr. Richardson, the family physician, claims to have seen a shadowy figure running away from the library.
witness.description: He describes the figure as tall and wearing a long coat.

npcs.name: Mrs. Smith
npcs.dialogue: I saw Mr. Johnson arguing with his son, Robert, the night before the murder. It was a heated argument.

npcs.name: Butler Jenkins
npcs.dialogue: I swear, I didn't hear or see anything unusual that night. I was in the pantry preparing dinner.

clues.Front Door: The front door shows signs of forced entry, suggesting that someone may have entered or left the house without permission.
clues.Library Door: The library door was left ajar, indicating that the killer may have entered or exited through this room.
clues.Kitchen Door: The kitchen door was locked from the inside, eliminating the possibility of someone entering or leaving through this exit.
clues.Lobby: In the lobby, Detective Parker finds a bloodstained knife hidden under a loose tile.
